column1: '''The Bridge of Catzad-Dum''' is a parody of [[A Journey in the Dark
column3: 5]] of Book 2 from [[The Fellowship of the Ring]] and the first novel of [[wikipedia:The Adventures of Samurai Cat
column4: The Adventures of Samurai Cat]] (a novel written by [[Wikipedia:Mark E. Rogers
column5: Mark E. Rogers]]).<Ref name="Tolkien Games">[http://www.lysator.liu.se/tolkien-games/entry/catzad-dum.html Tolkien Games] (retrieved 4 December 2010)</Ref> <ref name="El Anillo">[http://www.meristation.com/v3/des_articulo.php?pic=CON&id=2254&idj=&idp=&tipo=art&c=1&pos=5 Meristation, El Anillo interactivo] p. 6 (retrieved 4 December 2010)</ref> In this game you must revenge the death of your master.<ref name="El Anillo"/>

column1: The title is a wordplay, in the game all [[dwarves]] are replaced with cats.<ref name="Tolkien Games"/>  The game was written by [[Nathan Segerlind]].<ref name="Tolkien Games"/><ref name="El Anillo"/>
